page.title: 06The Village Hall
page.content: The new{Village Hall}complex is situated on the out-skirts of {Blackmore}.It covers an area of six acres.The{Recreation field}belongs to the{Blackmore Trust}.The land where the buildings,and the Tennis Courts and car park stand was given to the village by Mr.Marriage.There are eight {sporting activities}which are all clubs.Squash,football,cricket,snooker, tennis,darts,badminton and indoor bowls.The hall is used for{social {functions},drama and dancing.On the field there is play apparatus consisting of swings,roundabouts and a see-saw.The complex is run by the Village Hall committee and the{sports {and social club committee}.Each sport also has its own committee .In the lounge bar two people are employed.Events such as carol singing and discos are held.
